author: George Orwell
description: A chilling prophecy about the future where Big Brother watches everyone.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A world where humans are genetically bred and pharmaceutically controlled.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description: Firemen burn books in a future where reading is outlawed.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
description: A theocratic regime subjugates women in a totalitarian society.

title: Neuromancer
author: William Gibson
description: A hacker and an AI navigate a dystopian cyberpunk future.

title: Snow Crash
author: Neal Stephenson
description: A pizza delivery driver battles a digital virus in a corporate-dominated America.

title: The Hunger Games
author: Suzanne Collins
description: Children fight to the death in a televised spectacle in a post-apocalyptic nation.

title: Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep?
author: Philip K. Dick
description: A bounty hunter tracks down rogue androids in a devastated future Earth.

title: The Dispossessed
author: Ursula K. Le Guin
description: A physicist navigates between an anarchist moon colony and a capitalist planet.

title: We
author: Yevgeny Zamyatin
description: Citizens live in glass apartments under constant surveillance in a regimented society.

title: The Road
author: Cormac McCarthy
description: A father and son journey through a devastated, ash-covered America.

title: Station Eleven
author: Emily St. John Mandel
description: A traveling theater troupe performs Shakespeare in a post-pandemic world.

title: The Circle
author: Dave Eggers
description: A woman works at a powerful tech company that seeks total transparency.

title: Ready Player One
author: Ernest Cline
description: A teenager hunts for an Easter egg in a massive virtual reality universe.

title: The Left Hand of Darkness
author: Ursula K. Le Guin
description: An envoy visits a world where inhabitants can change gender.

title: The Giver
author: Lois Lowry
description: A boy discovers the dark truth behind his seemingly perfect society.

title: A Clockwork Orange
author: Anthony Burgess
description: A violent youth undergoes experimental behavior modification in a brutal future.

title: The Maze Runner
author: James Dashner
description: Teenagers trapped in a maze must find a way to escape their mysterious prison.

title: Parable of the Sower
author: Octavia E. Butler
description: A young woman with empathic abilities leads survivors through a collapsing America.

title: Oryx and Crake
author: Margaret Atwood
description: A man may be the last human alive after a genetically engineered plague.

title: The Windup Girl
author: Paolo Bacigalupi
description: In a future of scarce energy, bioengineered beings struggle for freedom.

title: Altered Carbon
author: Richard K. Morgan
description: Minds can be transferred between bodies in a noir cyberpunk future.

title: The Children of Men
author: P.D. James
description: Humanity faces extinction as no children have been born for 25 years.

title: The Power
author: Naomi Alderman
description: Women develop the ability to release electrical charges, reversing gender power dynamics.

title: Blindness
author: José Saramago
description: An epidemic of blindness causes society to break down.

title: The Peripheral
author: William Gibson
description: A woman witnesses a murder in the future through a virtual reality connection.

title: Divergent
author: Veronica Roth
description: Society is divided into factions based on virtues; those who don't fit are dangerous.

title: Never Let Me Go
author: Kazuo Ishiguro
description: Students at a boarding school discover they are clones raised for organ donation.

title: The Three-Body Problem
author: Liu Cixin
description: Scientists discover an alien civilization preparing to invade Earth.

title: The Diamond Age
author: Neal Stephenson
description: A young girl receives an interactive book designed to raise a neo-Victorian elite.

title: Cloud Atlas
author: David Mitchell
description: Six interconnected stories span from the 19th century to a post-apocalyptic future.

title: The Fifth Sacred Thing
author: Starhawk
description: An ecotopian San Francisco faces invasion from a militaristic regime.

title: The Man in the High Castle
author: Philip K. Dick
description: America is occupied by Nazi Germany and Japan in an alternate history.

title: Wool
author: Hugh Howey
description: Survivors live in a massive underground silo, forbidden to discuss the outside world.

title: The Lathe of Heaven
author: Ursula K. Le Guin
description: A man's dreams can alter reality, with terrifying consequences.

title: Kallocain
author: Karin Boye
description: A chemist invents a truth serum in a totalitarian state where privacy doesn't exist.

title: The Postman
author: David Brin
description: A drifter wearing a postman's uniform becomes a symbol of hope in post-apocalyptic America.

title: Anthem
author: Ayn Rand
description: In a collectivist future, a man rediscovers individualism and electricity.

title: The Space Merchants
author: Frederik Pohl & C.M. Kornbluth
description: Advertising agencies run a overpopulated Earth in this satirical dystopia.

title: Feed
author: M.T. Anderson
description: Teenagers have internet feeds implanted directly into their brains.

title: The Water Knife
author: Paolo Bacigalupi
description: Water has become the most precious commodity in a drought-ravaged American Southwest.

title: Ender's Game
author: Orson Scott Card
description: Children are trained through games to fight an alien threat.

title: The Drowned World
author: J.G. Ballard
description: Global warming has transformed Earth into a tropical hellscape.

title: The City & The City
author: China Miéville
description: Two cities occupy the same space, and citizens must 'unsee' the other city.

title: Red Mars
author: Kim Stanley Robinson
description: The first 100 colonists struggle to terraform Mars and establish a new society.

title: The Passage
author: Justin Cronin
description: A military experiment creates vampire-like creatures that destroy civilization.

title: The Trial
author: Franz Kafka
description: A man is arrested and prosecuted by an inaccessible authority for an unknown crime.

title: Vurt
author: Jeff Noon
description: People access alternate realities through psychoactive feathers in a grim Manchester.

title: The Forever War
author: Joe Haldeman
description: Soldiers fight an interstellar war while time passes differently on Earth.

title: Metro 2033
author: Dmitry Glukhovsky
description: Survivors live in Moscow's metro system after a nuclear war.

title: Daemon
author: Daniel Suarez
description: A dead game designer's AI begins executing a program to reshape society.

title: Battle Royale
author: Koushun Takami
description: Students are forced to fight to the death on an island by a totalitarian government.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
description: A theocratic regime subjugates women in a totalitarian society.

title: V for Vendetta
author: Alan Moore
description: A masked vigilante fights against a fascist government in Britain.

title: Little Brother
author: Cory Doctorow
description: Teenagers fight back against government surveillance after a terrorist attack.

title: Ubik
author: Philip K. Dick
description: Reality begins to decay for survivors of a psychic attack in this mind-bending tale.

title: The Stars My Destination
author: Alfred Bester
description: A man gains the power to teleport and seeks revenge in a future of corporate warfare.

title: Annihilation
author: Jeff VanderMeer
description: A team explores a mysterious zone where nature has become alien and dangerous.

title: The Minority Report
author: Philip K. Dick
description: Police arrest criminals before they commit crimes using precognitive mutants.

title: Elysium
author: Jennifer Marie Brissett
description: A dying AI recreates simulations of its creators' lives in various scenarios.

title: The Book of the New Sun
author: Gene Wolfe
description: A torturer's apprentice becomes the leader of a dying Earth in the far future.

title: Lord of the Flies
author: William Golding
description: British boys stranded on an island descend into savagery.

title: Player Piano
author: Kurt Vonnegut
description: Machines have automated most jobs, creating a rigid class system.

title: The Caves of Steel
author: Isaac Asimov
description: A detective partners with a robot to solve a murder in an overcrowded Earth.

title: The Sheep Look Up
author: John Brunner
description: Environmental pollution causes society to collapse in near-future America.

title: Stand on Zanzibar
author: John Brunner
description: Earth struggles with extreme overpopulation and social upheaval.

title: The Chrysalids
author: John Wyndham
description: Telepathic children hide their abilities in a post-apocalyptic religious society.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
description: Noble houses fight for control of the desert planet Arrakis and its spice.

title: A Canticle for Leibowitz
author: Walter M. Miller Jr.
description: Monks preserve knowledge through dark ages after nuclear war.

title: The Time Machine
author: H.G. Wells
description: A Victorian scientist travels to a future where humanity has split into two species.

title: Rainbows End
author: Vernor Vinge
description: An elderly poet regains his health in a world of ubiquitous augmented reality.

title: The Demolished Man
author: Alfred Bester
description: A businessman tries to commit murder in a world where telepathic police exist.

title: The Iron Heel
author: Jack London
description: A corporate oligarchy crushes labor movements in early 20th century America.

title: Snowpiercer
author: Jacques Lob
description: Survivors live on a perpetually moving train after Earth freezes over.

title: The Machine Stops
author: E.M. Forster
description: Humanity lives underground, dependent on an omnipotent Machine.

title: Brave New World Revisited
author: Aldous Huxley
description: Huxley's non-fiction analysis of how his fictional dystopia is becoming real.

title: The Penultimate Truth
author: Philip K. Dick
description: People live underground believing in a war that ended years ago.

title: Mockingbird
author: Walter Tevis
description: In a future where humans are illiterate and dying out, three people seek meaning.

title: The Wanting Seed
author: Anthony Burgess
description: Overpopulation leads to government promotion of homosexuality and cannibalism.

title: The Years of Rice and Salt
author: Kim Stanley Robinson
description: An alternate history where the Black Death killed 99% of Europeans.

title: When She Woke
author: Hillary Jordan
description: Criminals are chromatically altered as punishment in a theocratic America.

title: The Quantum Thief
author: Hannu Rajaniemi
description: A master thief is broken out of prison to commit the ultimate heist.

title: Flow My Tears, the Policeman Said
author: Philip K. Dick
description: A celebrity wakes up in a world where no one remembers him.

title: The Lifecycle of Software Objects
author: Ted Chiang
description: People raise digital artificial intelligences like children.

title: The Shockwave Rider
author: John Brunner
description: A man with multiple identities fights an authoritarian government through hacking.

title: Zone One
author: Colson Whitehead
description: Survivors clear zombies from Manhattan while rebuilding civilization.

title: The Futurological Congress
author: Stanisław Lem
description: Psychoactive drugs create false realities masking a dystopian world.

title: The War of the Worlds
author: H.G. Wells
description: Martians invade Earth with superior technology.

title: Swan Song
author: Robert McCammon
description: Survivors struggle in the aftermath of nuclear war.

title: Replay
author: Ken Grimwood
description: A man repeatedly dies and is reborn at age 18 with his memories intact.

title: The Invisible Man
author: H.G. Wells
description: A scientist becomes invisible and descends into madness and violence.

title: House of Suns
author: Alastair Reynolds
description: Clone siblings explore the galaxy over millions of years.

title: Cryptonomicon
author: Neal Stephenson
description: Parallel stories of WWII codebreakers and modern tech entrepreneurs.

title: The Book of Joan
author: Lidia Yuknavitch
description: Earth is destroyed and survivors live on a space station in this reimagining of Joan of Arc.

title: This Perfect Day
author: Ira Levin
description: A supercomputer controls all aspects of human life in a seemingly perfect world.

title: The Diamond Age
author: Neal Stephenson
description: A young girl receives an interactive book designed to raise a neo-Victorian elite.

title: Midnight Robber
author: Nalo Hopkinson
description: A girl and her father are exiled to a prison planet in this Afro-Caribbean sci-fi tale.

title: The Sparrow
author: Mary Doria Russell
description: Jesuits make first contact with aliens with tragic consequences.

title: Partials
author: Dan Wells
description: Humanity faces extinction from a plague created by their synthetic servants.

title: The Light of Other Days
author: Arthur C. Clarke & Stephen Baxter
description: Technology allows people to view any moment in history, ending all privacy.
